page.title: 12Bank Street, Braintree.
page.content: {Bank Street}is part of the traffic network in Braintree but over the last two years it has become pedestrianised with only delivery lorries allowed. The road is now blocked off with a mosaic of tiles. Years ago before the town's one way system came into use{Bank Street}was one of the main roads running through to the High street, linking the road from Halstead to Chelmsford. The fire engines used to run through{Bank Street}onto the crossroad at the White Hart Hotel, when entering and leaving the fire station, but they have built a new road so the vehicles can exit without conjestion. You can probably guess why it is called{Bank Street}as it has Lloyds, Barclays and the Midland Bank, along with a building society.
